document.title: Drilling Down the NC Arts Education Standards
document.source: Final NCSCOS Arts Education Framework - Google Docs.pdf
document.organization: North Carolina Department of PUBLIC INSTRUCTION

description: The following table describes how to drill down through the strand and standard to the objective level so that educators better understand the skills and knowledge which are developed K-12 throughout a discipline in the new North Carolina Standard Courses of Study in Dance, Music, Theatre Arts, and Visual Arts (2024).

strand.name: Connect
strand.subtitle: Explore and relate artistic ideas and works to past, present, and future societies and cultures.

standards.big_idea: Relate <artistic> ideas and works with personal, societal, cultural, and historical, and daily life contexts, including diverse and marginalized groups.

objectives.focused_idea: Deepen understanding of artistic ideas by relating to historic, societal, cultural, and/or daily life contexts

essential_questions: How do the world and this artform influence one another?
How do school, life, and arts education skills relate to one another?

standards.big_idea: Explore advancements in the field of <my art>

objectives.focused_idea: Postsecondary opportunities and careers of art professionals
Explore innovative methods, tools, and technologies used by artists in the professional industry

essential_questions: What college and/or career opportunities exist in this artform?
How is the artform transforming in the world?

strand.name: Create
strand.subtitle: Create and adapt new artistic ideas and work individually or collaboratively.

standards.big_idea: Create original <artistic> ideas and work, independently and collaboratively.

objectives.focused_idea: Improvise, or experiment with, original works of art

essential_questions: How does exploration, experimentation, improvisation, and investigation happen in art-making?
How are original works created and documented?

standards.big_idea: Adapt original <artistic> ideas and works, and those of peers and other artists, independently and collaboratively.

objectives.focused_idea: Arrange, adapt, or derive from other artistic ideas
Explain how artistic works are protected, shared, and used fairly by audiences and other artists.

essential_questions: How can artwork be adapted or modified with new ideas without appropriating?
How does an artist protect their work or use another artists' work fairly?

strand.name: Present
strand.subtitle: Perform, produce, present, and develop my own and others' artistic ideas and work

standards.big_idea: Perform <artistic> work from a variety of styles, cultures, and genres.
essential_questions: What steps can be taken to improve as an artist?
How can skills be presented informally or formally to an audience with clarity and focus?

objectives.focused_idea: Identify the production needs of presentations
Demonstrate audience and presenter etiquette appropriate to the context of a presentation

essential_questions: What does it take to produce a presentation or performance?
How does the venue and presentation formality influence meaning and performer/presenter and audience etiquette?

strand.name: Respond
strand.subtitle: Analyze and evaluate how the arts communi- cate with their audience

standards.big_idea: Analyze <artistic> works from a variety of styles, cultures, and genres using content-specific vocabulary.

objectives.focused_idea: Identify skills and techniques used in <artistic> works
Interpret intent and purpose in <artistic> work

essential_questions: Why did the artist make specific creative choices?

objectives.focused_idea: Examine the effect of personal preferences
Evaluate artistic work and provide feedback

essential_questions: How do personal preferences influence responses to artwork?
How can feedback be given to self and others?
